instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power cycles
threads.message:
I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no sign of spillage on the board. When charger connected it goes to 370ma then to 20ma twice then stays at 20ma

<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> all pins except 8 pulse twice, pin 8 has 3.42v.

<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>
pin 23 - 8.58V
pin 12 - 3.3v
pin 13 - 2.3v ??  should it be 3.3v? no shorts here
pin 22 3.3v
pin 29 - 5v
pin 21 - 3.3v

Then
L7520 diode .385
L7560 diode .310
Also tried new bios with cleaned me.

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> reads
1-3.42v
2-gnd
3-3.42v
4-2.73v ??? should this be 3.3v?
5-8 - 3.3v

Any ideas appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power cycles
threads.message:
All posted voltages look good.

This symptom goes from a simple resistor until CPU.
I Never saw a clear fix for it and CPU is the culprit many times.

Tried SMC bypass mode?

Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces; found broken trace one time.
Inspect <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>/600, resolder/change them; <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> failed one time.
Reball/change SMC; solved one time reballing.
Heat CPU with quality flux; helped one time, heating especially PCH side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power cycles
threads.message:
Heating Pch section with flux resloved the issue.

Many thanks
